alert.note: Alert for Eastern Louisa; Goochland; Western Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LOUISA...WESTERN GOOCHLAND AND NORTHWESTERN HANOVER COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fife, or near Cartersville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fife around 530 PM EDT. Hadensville and Gum Spring around 545 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Orchid, Sandy Hook, Three Square, Irwin, Mabelton, Cuckoo, Elk Hill, Dabneys, Yanceyville, and West View. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
